name: 2-chloro-1-phenylsulfonamidobenzene
source: RAEVSKY OA; PERLOVICH GL and SCHAPER K-J. Physicochemical properties/descriptors governing the solubility and partitioning of chemicals in water-solvent-gas systems. Part 2. Solubility in 1-octanol. SAR and QSAR in Environmental Research Vol. 18 Nos. 5–6 July–September 2007 543–578
Reason:
The presence of a sulfonamide group in the molecule increases the molecular weight and introduces a polar functional group capable of forming hydrogen bonds. The aromatic ring also contributes to the molecular weight and rigidity. The chlorine substituent increases the molecular weight and introduces a polar functional group capable of forming ionic interactions. The phenyl group also contributes to the molecular weight and rigidity.

Starting with a base melting point of around 20°C for simple long chain hydrocarbons, these adjustments lead to a total estimation.
